item.title: HP Victus Gaming Laptop Is Only $430 At Best Buy In Early Black Friday Doorbuster Sale
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/hp-victus-gaming-laptop-is-only-430-at-best-buy-in-early-black-friday-doorbuster-sale/1100-6527616/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Best Buy just launched an awesome early Black Friday Doorbuster deal that drops HP's 15.6-inch Victus gaming laptop down to just $430, a massive price cut compared to its usual $800 list price. You need to be a My Best Buy Plus/Total member to snag this deal right now, but it will be available to all shoppers tonight at 10 PM PT / 1 AM ET--as long as it doesn't sell out before then. This HP Victus laptop is one of four early Black Friday Doorbusters up for grabs at Best Buy through November 10.

This specific model runs on an AMD Ryzen 5-7535HS processor, AMD Radeon RX 6550M graphics card, and 8GB of DDR5 memory, plus a 512GB SSD for installing games and storing your files.

This HP Victus is a solid budget choice for casual gaming or as a gift for younger PC gamers who are getting started with the hobby, especially while it's only $430. The Ryzen 5 CPU is a mid-range processor, whereas the GPU and RAM are entry-level components best suited for less graphically intensive games. Many indie games and older AAA titles should work just fine, but don't expect great performance with newer AAA hits like Call of Duty: Black Ops 6. We mention Black Ops specifically, because it's featured in the product images for this laptop.

We've seen similar HP Victus gaming laptops go on sale for around $500-$550 during big sales events like Prime Day, but it's very rare to see an entry-level gaming laptop for this low of a price.

This HP Victus gaming laptop discount is not the only early Black Friday Door Buster deal. You can also pick up Samsung's giant 75-inch Crystal UHD 4K smart TV for $550 (down from $750), and LG's 45-inch curved OLED UltraGear gaming monitor, which offers a 1440p resolution and 240Hz refresh rate with support for FreeSync, Nvidia G-Sync, and HDR400, for just $1,100 (normally $1,700). Like the HP Victus deal, these discounts are available through November 10, or until they sell out.

Best Buy Early Black Friday Door Buster Deals (November 8 - 10)

  • HP Victus 15.6-inch Gaming Laptop - AMD Ryzen 5-7535HS, 8GB DDR5 Memory, AMD Radeon RX 6550M, 512GB SSD -- $430 ($800)
  • Samsung 75-inch Class DU6950 Series Crystal UHD 4K Smart Tizen TV (2024 model) -- $550 ($750)
  • LG UltraGear 45-inch OLED Curved WQHD 240Hz Gaming Monitor -- $1,100 ($1,700)
  • Dyson Digital Slim Cordless Vacuum -- $230 ($500)

While Best Buy's Doorbuster deals are worth checking out, they're not the only early discounts to expect. Target's Early Black Friday three-day sale runs through November 9, and Walmart's first round of deals go live on November 11--and Walmart+ members can access those offers up to five hours early. Even more Black Friday deals will go live throughout the month, so be sure to keep an eye on GameSpot's deals coverage for all the latest discounts.

  • PS5 Pro Disc Drive Is Sold Out At Most Retailers, But Walmart Has It (For Now)
  • PS5 Pro Preorders - Release-Day Delivery Still Available At Select Retailers
  • Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom And Echoes Of Wisdom Get Stellar Discounts
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard Collector's Edition In Stock On Launch Day For PS5 And Xbox
  • Lord Of The Rings 4K Gift Set Releases This Holiday, Comes With One Ring Collectible
  • Target's Exclusive Shadow The Hedgehog Lego Set Is Discounted Just Weeks After Its Release
  • New Lego Super Mario And Peach Starter Sets Get First Discounts At Amazon
  • Elden Ring Official Art Books Are B1G1 50% Off At Amazon - Get Both For Only $59
Brendan Hesse on Google+

item.title: No Man's Sky Finally Has A Cross-Save Feature With Latest Patch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/no-mans-sky-finally-has-a-cross-save-feature-with-latest-patch/1100-6527633/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Starting today, Hello Games is rolling out cross-save compatibility to a select number of No Man's Sky players. While not everyone will have access immediately, all players can now link their different accounts on the No Man's Sky cross-save website. Hello Games says that all players will be able to do the same in "the coming weeks."

It's a pretty straightforward process to get started. Players simply sign in to a platform account--PSN, Xbox Live, Steam, GOG, with Nintendo Switch Online coming soon--using the links provided and follow the instructions to connect any accounts they have on other devices. Then simply launch No Man's Sky on one of the connected platforms. It should be noted that the players' most recent save will automatically be uploaded to the server, and made available for download on your other connected platforms.

Players only need to connect a single account, this allows the ability to transfer saves between a PS4 and a PS5, for example, if you're logged into the same PSN account. The feature only allows for five cross-saves.

The update also sees Mass Effect's iconic Normandy ship coinciding with the launch of N7 Day, which celebrates the Mass Effect series. A new limited-time expedition starts today, with the chance to add the cruiser to your fleet if you can complete it in time. This event will only be around for the next two weeks, so players should hurry and head to the stars if they missed out the first time.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: NBA 2K25's $8 Futuristic Minigame Is "Exciting," But Not Necessarily "A Trend," Says Take-Two Boss
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/nba-2k25s-8-futuristic-minigame-is-exciting-but-not-necessarily-a-trend-says-take-two-boss/1100-6527631/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Basketball is the name of the game with NBA 2K25, but developer Visual Concepts decided to mix things up last month with Gravity Ball. The $8 add-on was described by the studio as "a mashup of American-Gladiators-meets-futuristic-basketball-meets-paintball."

During a Take-Two Interactive earnings call, an analyst asked CEO Strauss Zelnick if NBA 2K25 adding the futuristic mode might be a new model for major franchises going forward. "I mentioned our three-part strategy, and the middle part being innovation, and I'm really proud that Visual Concepts and 2K decided to innovate with Gravity Ball, most importantly, creatively," Zelnick answered. "And then secondarily, as a matter of business model. And we've already learned a lot. It's a great little minigame, really terrific."

NBA 2K25 | Official Gameplay Trailer

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Zelnick added that "consumers really like" Gravity Ball in NBA 2K25, though stressed that it's "too early to call it a trend." While Fortnite has turned into a bigger platform for a host of games--Fortnite Festival and Lego Fortnite, for example--Take-Two isn't necessarily going all in on that strategy.

"It's too early to say that, 'OK, our future is paid minigames inside bigger platform-type games.' But I think it's a reflection of the fact that our creative teams are open-minded and are willing to try new things and aren't being precious about the IP that they create," Zelnick said.

The Take-Two CEO had a lot to say on the earnings call, not just related to NBA 2K25. Zelnick touched on the Borderlands movie bombing, though noted it actually helped video game sales for the series. He also explained that only focusing on sequels could spell disaster.

NBA 2K25 launched in September on PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and Nintendo Switch. The Gravity Ball mode was introduced last month, but it's only available on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: CoD: Warzone's Area 99 Season 1 Trailer Features Dirt Bike Action And New Cosmetics
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/cod-warzones-area-99-season-1-trailer-features-dirt-bike-action-and-new-cosmetics/1100-6527632/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Season 1 arrives in Call of Duty on November 14, and the big update will finally integrate Black Ops 6 with Warzone. A new Warzone trailer has released to show off some of the Season 1 content, including plenty of vehicular combat on the new Area 99 Resurgence map.

Fitting for the '90s setting of Black Ops 6, the Season 1 trailer opens with The Offspring's classic hit "Come Out and Play." The gameplay is featured on the upcoming Area 99 Resurgence map, which Treyarch has described as the birthplace of Nuketown. The action reveals the map will also feature helicopters, dirt bikes, and four-wheelers.

For hints of Season 1 content, several operator skins and weapon blueprints are teases. Sevati Dumas is featured with a new operator skin that gives her an edgy look, as she's glammed up with pink hair, chains, and tattoos. Maya from Zombies also has a new skin, plus there are several masked operator skins shown off, including a soldier in studded leather biker gear.

A C9 submachine blueprint is revealed, which features an illustrated image of an angry fox. The trailer also hints at a sniper rifle that looks much like the popular Barrett .50 Cal from the original Modern Warfare 2. It's uncertain if this will be one of the new DLC weapons in Season 1, or if this is a weapon blueprint that turns an existing sniper into a cosmetic variant of the weapon.

Season 1 is set to integrate all of Black Ops 6's content into Warzone. This includes the game's weapon pool, operators, and Treyarch's new omnimovement mechanics.

For more on Black Ops 6 and Warzone, here is everything announced for Season 1 so far, including new multiplayer maps and Zombies content. You can also check out GameSpot's Black Ops 6 campaign, multiplayer, and Zombies reviews.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
